title-group.article-title: Special Prime Numbers and Discrete Logs in Finite Prime Fields

abstract.p: A set A of primes p involving numbers such as abt + c, where |a|, |b|, |c| = 0(1) and t → ∞, is defined. An algorithm for computing discrete logs in the finite field of order p with p ∈ A is suggested. Its heuristic expected running time is Lp [1/3; (32/9)1/3] for (32/9)1/3 = 1.526..., where Lp[α;β] = exp((β + o(1))lnα p(ln ln p)1 - α) as p → ∞, 0 < α < 1, and 0 α β. At present, the most efficient algorithm for computing discrete logs in the finite field of order p for general p is Schirokauer's adaptation of the Number Field Sieve. Its heuristic expected running time is Lp[1/3; (64/9)1/3] for (64/9)1/3 = 1.9229⋯. Using p ∈ rather than general p does not enhance the performance of Schirokauer's algorithm. The definition of the set A and the algorithm suggested in this paper are based on a more general congruence than that of the Number Field Sieve. The congruence is related to the resultant of integer polynomials. We also give a number of useful identities for resultants that allow us to specify this congruence for some p.
